Topic.Title: Verizon loses deal to AT&T and Verizon up AT&T down. Weird

Message.Msg: Some trader just push the stock price down for no reason. The guy is just shorting the stock up top and doing quick turn around trades to bring down the price on unrelated market news. T does not have much risk exposure to the eurozone, Italy or the yen. A trader just created artificial weights on the company and he push down the stock to gain from his bets against other investors ( likely someone clients). Also, this nonsense may be related to the Soft Bank move on S. Regulators should keep a close watch on this stock to insure that foreign companies are not trying bet against T while using S. They should be look at the total amount of spectrum a foreign company will control from the close of a S deal. That deal also should not go through without major restrictions for security reasons. Something does not seem right here. I smell a major short seller is involved in this nonsense. Right now he is trying to range bound this stock price with hopes of using a high risk S deal to push it down. S will still find it hard to compete in this market will only $20 billion in new investment and a high debt load. That money will likely be gone in 2 years, especially if it tries to expand or improve its network while paying off debt. This stock should be well on its way to $38 a share.

Topic.Title: Republican Accomplishments

Message.Msg: I think the problem is that we have not had a true economic policy in years. I also think that aggregated income will key the key to global economic growth. Th raise in incomes and the expansion of incomes should the most important point of any plan for growth. Central to all economic theories is the growth income income levels and the expansion of income. Taxes are created through income and consumption/demand is also related to incomes. Savings and investments are also directly related to incomes. We can theorize the Laffer Curve in many different ways but the fact is that a decrease incomes will result in a decrease tax revenues. High unemployment will make it worse with aggregated incomes decreasing and with very little effort to redistribute wealth from the higher income brackets to the poor and middle class.. We should maximizing income levels with a balance tax policy to close the deficit gap instead of engaging in policies that promote self interest. of a few or a pure capitalist system. Aggregated income levels is the the key. Put the money in the hands of many who consume and taxes, they will put pressure on supply which with create more household incomes.

Topic.Title: Has the gun control agenda changed since the civil war?

Message.Msg: ... “Of course. Because researching policy matters is embarrassing. Why research? Policies should simply channeled fully formed from corporate lobbyists through Rush Limbaugh and directly into your head. Don't think. Don't research. Don't consider. Just repeat. Good trained monkey” - ricky18201 Having followed the antics of this board for quite some time, I wouldn’t give windandale anywhere near as much credit as simply being a Tea Party trained monkey. There are, indeed, many ditto heads being led around on a leash by the likes of organ grinding, tin-cup hustlers like Limbaugh and Beck…their audience being comprised of largely bigoted analphabets too ingrained with fear and intolerance for any rational thinking of their own. But there are also people like windandale and others, whose only purpose in being here is outlandish demagoguery, intended to flame those fears and to continue to try to spread the word of the 2 %, despite having been soundly rejected by Middle America. It’s comical to watch them jump from one alias to the next, responding to themselves, while trying their best to denigrate any form of government and obstruct any meaningful legislation that would better all of America. Why on earth would anyone who is actually included in that top 2% be relentlessly posting on a stock message board 24/7? Listening to winny’s tired refrain here makes you think he’s a direct spokesperson for the Koch Brothers. He’s an advocate for their war against Obama by championing climate science denial, Citizens United, voter suppression through gerrymandering, all while fighting gun legislation, health care reform, economic stimulus or social safety programs of any kind. No, winny is not simply some ditto head. He’s here for a purpose…to spread the message of a no oversight, Laissez-faire system from the folks who thought Mitt Romney represents middle class America and that almost half of Americans are bums. To put it in perspective: “The Kochs are on a whole different level. There’s no one else who has spent this much money. The sheer dimension of it is what sets them apart. They have a pattern of lawbreaking, political manipulation, and obfuscation. I’ve been in Washington since Watergate, and I’ve never seen anything like it. They are the Standard Oil of our times.” - Charles Lewis, the founder of the Center for Public Integrity, a nonpartisan watchdog group (Interestingly, there are actually FOUR Koch brothers. But David and Charles, like all good vulture capitalists, found greed preferable over humanity and funding the Tea Party and Americans for Prosperity far more important than brotherhood.) “You should be embarrassed winholder. You are embarrassing yourself.” - ricky Yes he should be embarrassed, but since when do Wall Street pimps have any conscience?... and, hey, it’s a job. A pretty pathetic one, but it keeps him off the streets.

Topic.Title: Top of the news

Message.Msg: Seems like every morning AT&T gets great news out but by the end of the day the stock price is down. However the 200 DMA is moving up and T has been trading just above it for over a month. The long term trend is up and the yield is more like 100% if you sell the calls every morning and buy them back in the afternoon. Of course you must have over $25,000 in your account to do that. Otherwise buy calls at the close and sell them at the open. It is a wonderful life.

Topic.Title: Millions Said to Be Wasted on U.S. Rural Broadband Expansion

Message.Msg: No money was wasted. This was one Congress person ranting about an Inspector's General report that found $500,000 & $1.2 million out of a $7 billion program was "overspent". The people who spent it, the state of West Virginia, do not agree. In any case, to characterize this as "millions wasted" is ridiculous. It's less than one thousandth of one percent of the program. It should be characterized as "only about $1 million out of $7,000 million use disputed". And the Inspector General auditors tracked it down.

Topic.Title: Millions Said to Be Wasted on U.S. Rural Broadband Expansion

Message.Msg: In typical ricky18201 fashion you take two or three sentences out of a long article about government waste and attack just that one example. The important point made was that many millions were wasted by the government competing with private enterprise.

Topic.Title: Millions Said to Be Wasted on U.S. Rural Broadband Expansion

Message.Msg: According to Congressman Greg Walden of Oregon. According to a vote of the House & Senate and signature of the President, continued funding over several years by three congresses, and reelection of the president who spearheaded the program, it is a worthwhile program. It is one thing to say you don't like the program, or that you think it competes with private companies. It is quite another to claim millions were "wasted". The only possible "waste" cited in the article was the $500,000 to $1.2 million in the Inspector General's report.

Topic.Title: Has the gun control agenda changed since the civil war?

Message.Msg: I did post it and it is true. There is no Federal registry. Any permitting is performed at the state or local level. Shop owners keep records of sales and tracking numbers. Beyond that there is no registry. Your argument is that the president is lying and that the government is secretly maintaining an illegal registry. Not even the NRA believes that a Federal gun registry exists. You seem to believe that because I don't think the president, the Congressional Budget Office, and, indeed, just about every government official (elected or otherwise), member of the media, or research organization, EXCEPT for the right-wing media is lying, I must be a trained monkey. Just like you think the State of Hawaii, through multiple administrations, is lying to you about Obama's births certificate. I will give you one thing. Trained monkey you are not, Wilkes. You're just nuts.

Topic.Title: The next crisis

Message.Msg: It would have been much less of a 'crisis' if someone proposing the broad changes to health care would have considered what it would take to accomplish the task instead of simply generating a bill in Congress and passing it without even being read by a large number of those voting for it. It is simply yet another example of the thoughtlessness, lack of accountability and stupidity of our government, in this case particularly on the part of the liberals. I was not confused, it was published by the MSM that it was going to cause delays, and cost millions if not billions to get the required system up to speed. I have plenty of experience in implementing new process and computer systems throughout my working career and while several of those were unmitigated disasters, they won't hold a candle to what is about to befall the American people. Either this administration is telling stories about the level of crisis in so many instances or they are terrible managers of time, money, and effort and simply can't stop everything from becoming a crisis. Either way they are inept managers of the nation’s treasury and resources. Your excuses are just that.

Topic.Title: The next crisis

Message.Msg: There is some truth to your post; you find alternative derogatory labels or titles to use in place of idiot. The end result is the same. The President would not be proud of your inflammatory speech. Hang your head a look ashamed.

Message.Title: The status quo won't get it done
Message.Msg: This current crisis called sequestration is yet another invented crisis by this failing administration. The end result is that the government will be spend about the same as last year and only the pace of growth of spending will be reduced. Businesses do this on a yearly, sometimes monthly basis and survive. The end of the world scenario being painted by Obama is a political shock tactic and most Americans know it. What problems there are can be related easily to the lack of a budget for the past three years, the lack of any negotiation skills on the part of many in Congress and other places in Washington. The liberal wing of this government still has not come to the realization that we cannot continue at an increasingly higher level without seriously putting this country in grave danger. This crisis was fashioned in Washington by the members of Congress, their bloated staffs, the White House cabinet staff and the President himself. It will not be resolved in Topeka, or in Virginia. It will have to be resolved in Washington, unfortunately by the same cast of incompetent worms that caused it. The President needs to get his lazy butt off Air Force One, stop the campaign speeches (he won, he told us so on multiple occasions) and get back into his office and meet with the fools that created this mess and see if they can find a way out and will allow them to save some of the little dignity they have left. He is afraid to sit with anyone that disagrees with him and try to work a deal like the one being offered by the Republicans today. He asked for this to protect his campaign efforts and thought he could simply forces a different deal if he won. It’s not working that way for him and he hasn’t the intestinal fortitude to meet the challenge like a man. He is a great speaker (when the advantage of the teleprompter is present) by a man of weak character.

Topic.Title: How's that good old liberal tolerance working for you?

Message.Msg: In a pew in church, while reverently preparing for the service, I heard a little old lady, sitting next to me, quietly whispering a prayer. It was so sincere, I just had to share it with you. She said, "Dear Lord, this has been a tough two or three years. You have taken my favorite actor, Patrick Swayze; my favorite musician, Michael Jackson; my favorite salesman, Billy Mays; my favorite actress, Elizabeth Taylor; my favorite singer, Whitney Houston; and now, my favorite announcer, #$%$ Clark. I just wanted you to know my favorite politician is Barack Obama. Amen."

Topic.Title: Has the gun control agenda changed since the civil war?

Message.Msg: IMHO the real point is that there is one political party that has historically supported restrictive and in some instances unconstitutional gun control laws. Further none of these laws have ever resulted in the improvement of a law abiding citizen's ability to defend himself against well armed criminals. And from an international perspective, the progressive agenda is and always will be the confiscation of firearms from all law abiding citizens. This agenda is well documented and IMHO even ricky would have a hard time disputing it. So IMHO arguing whether POTUS or his party currenty support a federal gun registry is moot, because the real progressive agenda is total gun confiscation, but they will take whatever gun control laws they can get away with whenever they can. This is incremental gun control and is just one of the methods used to achieve the progressive agenda. "In your heart you know he right." The Frogg

Topic.Title: The status quo won't get it done

Message.Msg: In times long gone by there were two sorts of people; one, the diligent, intelligent, and, above all, frugal elite; the other, lazy rascals, spending their substance, and more, in riotous living. The legend of theological original sin tells us certainly how man came to be condemned to eat his bread in the sweat of his brow; but the history of economic original sin reveals to us that there are people to whom this is by no means essential. Never mind! Thus it came to pass that the former sort accumulated wealth, and the latter sort had at last nothing to sell except their own skins. And from this original sin dates the poverty of the great majority that, despite all its labour, has up to now nothing to sell but itself, and the wealth of the few that increases constantly although they have long ceased to work. Such insipid childishness is every day preached to us in the defence of property. M. Thiers, e.g., had the assurance to repeat it with all the solemnity of a statesman to the French people, once so spirituel. But as soon as the question of property crops up, it becomes a sacred duty to proclaim the intellectual food of the infant as the one thing fit for all ages and for all stages of development. In actual history it is notorious that conquest, enslavement, robbery, murder, briefly force, play the great part.

Message.Title: Will the American people care when they find out the truth about sequestration?
Message.Msg: On Friday March 1, 2013 the so called sequestration, that was proposed by the administration during the summer of 2011 will go into effect. Sequestration will cut $85,000,000.000.00 (actually $44,000,000,000.00 between March 1 and September 30, 2013) from the current expenditures of $3,800,000,000,000.00 leaving the government with only $3,715,000,000,000.00 to spend on government programs. Based upon these cuts, our "dear leader" has (on a daily basis) warned us about the dangers to our free society if these draconian cuts are allowed to take place. The real question is what will happen when the American people discover the real effects of cutting 2.2% from a $3.8 trillion budget. What if first responders are able to continue their functions, school children are still able to be educated, and the military is still able to protect us? What if the sequestor happens and no one knows the difference? IMHO it should be interesting. "In your heart you know he is right." The Frogg
